title: Bourbon Tasting Event at Club Mareva Beirut

content.raw:
Club Mareva Beirut hosted an amazing bourbon tasting on Thursday November 7, exploring the nuanced world of American whiskey. Here’s a recap of our bourbon adventure: The Lineup:
Buffalo Trace - We began with this iconic bourbon, known for its smooth, complex character. The tasting notes of dark chocolate, caramel, and a hint of spice were a perfect introduction, setting a high bar for the evening. - Buffalo Trace Distillery
Angel’s Envy - This bourbon, finished in port wine barrels, offered a unique twist. The added depth with rich fruit flavors and a velvety finish was a revelation for many, showcasing how finishing can elevate a spirit. - Angel's Envy Website
Four Roses Single Barrel - Renowned for its floral notes, this bourbon surprised with its balance of sweetness and spice. The discussion around how single barrel selections can vary widely was enlightening, emphasizing the artisanal nature of bourbon crafting. - Four Roses Website
Maker’s Mark 101 - With its higher proof, this bourbon brought a bold statement to the table. The robust flavors of toffee, vanilla, and a touch of citrus zest were a delightful challenge to our palates. - Maker's Mark Website
Wild Turkey Rare Breed Barrel Proof - The finale was a bold, uncut, and unfiltered bourbon. Its high proof didn't overwhelm but rather enhanced the layers of flavor, from toasted oak to deep, lingering spices. - Wild Turkey Website  
Highlights:
  • Complexity: Bourbon's complexity rivaled that of single malt whisky, showcasing a variety of flavors from sweet to spicy.
  • Educational Insights: Our host, Jean Paul, shared knowledge on bourbon's production, from grain selection to aging.
Reflections:
The event redefined perceptions of bourbon, highlighting its craft and diversity. It was a night of learning, tasting, and celebrating the art of bourbon making, leaving everyone with a deeper appreciation for this spirit.
 
Stay tuned for more exclusive events at Club Mareva Beirut.

content.text: Club Mareva Beirut hosted an amazing bourbon tasting on Thursday November 7, exploring the nuanced world of American whiskey. Here’s a recap of our bourbon adventure: The Lineup: Buffalo Trace - We began with this iconic bourbon, known for its smooth, complex character. The tasting notes of dark chocolate, caramel, and a hint of spice were a perfect introduction, setting a high bar for the evening. - Buffalo Trace Distillery Angel’s Envy - This bourbon, finished in port wine barrels, offered a unique twist. The added depth with rich fruit flavors and a velvety finish was a revelation for many, showcasing how finishing can elevate a spirit. - Angel's Envy Website Four Roses Single Barrel - Renowned for its floral notes, this bourbon surprised with its balance of sweetness and spice. The discussion around how single barrel selections can vary widely was enlightening, emphasizing the artisanal nature of bourbon crafting. - Four Roses Website Maker’s Mark 101 - With its higher proof, this bourbon brought a bold statement to the table. The robust flavors of toffee, vanilla, and a touch of citrus zest were a delightful challenge to our palates. - Maker's Mark Website Wild Turkey Rare Breed Barrel Proof - The finale was a bold, uncut, and unfiltered bourbon. Its high proof didn't overwhelm but rather enhanced the layers of flavor, from toasted oak to deep, lingering spices. - Wild Turkey Website Highlights: Complexity : Bourbon's complexity rivaled that of single malt whisky, showcasing a variety of flavors from sweet to spicy. Educational Insights : Our host, Jean Paul, shared knowledge on bourbon's production, from grain selection to aging. Reflections: The event redefined perceptions of bourbon, highlighting its craft and diversity. It was a night of learning, tasting, and celebrating the art of bourbon making, leaving everyone with a deeper appreciation for this spirit.
